is a sparsely populated and poor region in the north-west of
, little visited because of its poor roads and backward infrastructure.

value: - capital of Benishangul-Gumuz, near the western Ethiopian escarpment

The people are, nominally at least, evenly divided between Muslims and Christians and seem to rub along quite happily. There has recently been an influx of mining companies and NGO personnel which has meant the urban population has tripled to more than 100,000 in the last ten years.
Apart from bamboo thickets and the dusty exhibits in the brand-spanking-new-and-falling-apart-already regional museum in Assosa, there's not a lot to see.

value: price=USD20 and up (big discounts for long stays)
content=Has a giant TV screen with satellite TV but no internet connection. Generator and water still. Check the air-conditioning units and plumbing before you decide on your room.

prophylaxis and anti-rabies vaccinations are essential.
